moves.2. Nc3: This move looked strange the first time I saw it, but attacking d5.
moves.2... g6: So I'm thinking black may Fianchetto his bishop, but I have been fooled here before. I am wondering if black will move d5 and cause me to change plans.
moves.3. e4: Normally, I would move g3 and prepare my fortress, but I'm suspicious of a d5 pawn move, which I am not sure how to handle, so I take the initiative. I do really prefer to be on the assertive side.
moves.4. Be2: Reducing the chance of a black Bd4 queen threat and preparing the castle.
moves.4... c5: Now that is a nice looking pawn chain black has. My pawns look a little weak.
moves.5. d3: Remedied the weak pawns. I like this configuration as well. Opens up both sides. However, the rear pawn requires constant defense with those pesky knights roaming about.
moves.6. Bd2: Additional defense of the knight and opening up the possibility of the long castle. Although with the black pawn chain, I don't think I'll castle queen side.
moves.7. Qa4: Temporary fix for the growing pressure on d4.
moves.7... O-O: Well, I did say temporary. White queen is not thrilled about that, but I guess it's to be expected.
moves.8. Nf3: Didn't like blocking in my LSB, but I thought the black Kd4 move would not be fun either.
moves.8... Rb8: Not sure what Rb8 signaled. Black b5 to threaten queen? ... or a future LSB move?
moves.9... Bg4: Not sure what this is called, but looks like he pinned my knight.
moves.10. Rae1: Want to cover  my bishop so I can move the knight to discourage black's Nd4 (which I really think he wants at this point). However, my b2 pawn looks a bit helpless.
moves.10... a6: b5 appears imminent. Must move queen, must move queen.
moves.11... Nd7: b2! Get out of the way!!!
moves.12. Ng5: Um, who did that. I didn't move that piece. Well, what I thought I would do is sacrifice my knight to break up the fortress a bit. What I actually accomplished was to lose the game... by this one move.
moves.14... e6: Now, I was still considering Nxh7, but Terence talked me down from the move. He walked me through the scenarios: b5 and Nxh7. In addition, he indicated that, while the knight on g4 was lost, I could still save the other knight and my queen by moving...
moves.16. exd5: Now this is another error. I should have moved cxd5 instead. Moving pawns toward the center.
moves.17. Qd1: "Well, be that way, your king is on the other side anyway!" - unhappy white queen
moves.17... bxc4 18. Nxh7: Not sure why, but that knight had a suicide mission since he was moved there.
moves.18... Kxh7: Seems like with the rooks and queen almost lined up with that open file, white would be able to do something.
moves.19. Rh3+ Kg8 20. f5: Now, I truly thought I was onto something here. I just didn't factor in the black knight on d7.
moves.22... cxd3 23. Qh4: I want the bishop to come up and help
moves.23... Rxb2 24. Bg5: Just hoping for a black error here.
moves.24... Re8: That pretty much clinches it, the game is all downhill from here.
moves.26. Qh5 Ne2+ 27. Kh1 Nf2+ 28. Rxf2 Rb1+: Thanks Terence for the game. I learned a lot.
